body.p: Using content reference to reuse elements that themselves have references to other resources, such as images, can be problematic because of the need to rewrite pointers. In the case of images, the map-driven processing graphic source-to-output map can potentially be thrown off by conref because it has to know the source location of the image and that information is not clearly maintained in the intermediate files produced by the Open Toolkit as of version 1.6.3.
The main use case is where a conref reuses a <fig> element from a topic that is in a different relative location to the image than the referencing topic.
